newsitem.title: USA: Wal-Mart tests new online payment method.
newsitem.headline: Wal-Mart tests new online payment method.

text.p: Wal-Mart Stores Inc said Monday they have endorsed a new payment card security mechanism called the Secure Electronic Transaction (SET) protocol and have started to implement it on a trial basis for its Wal-Mart Online store.

This technology, jointly developed and endorsed by the major payment card companies, will allow consumers to purchase merchandise on the Internet using encryption technology and a "digital certificate" mechanism that enhances existing online security.

The digital certificate provides confidentiality, ensures payment integrity and authenticates merchant identity. It also keeps files in an electronic wallet that is protected by the consumer's selected password, Wal-Mart said.

"We know our customers want to conduct transactions in a highly secure manner and that is why we have taken a leadership position in being the first merchant to offer the SET payment option," said David Glass, president and chief executive for Wal-Mart Stores.

Companies participating in the new payment card security technology include American Express Co, Chase Manhattan Bank, First Data Corp, Globeset, GTE Corp, International Business Machines Corp and MasterCard International.
